title: Man shoots himself in hand during robbery of local business
content:
Shreveport police have arrested a man who shot himself in the hand while attempting to rob a local business.
Patrol officers responded to the report of a suspicious person just after 4:45 a.m. Saturday in the 7000 block of West 70th Street.
Witnesses reported hearing what sounded like glass breaking nearby. Officers then discovered broken glass at the Great Wall Restaurant in the 7000 block of Pines Road.
Subsequently notified of a man suffering a gunshot wound to the hand nearby, officers found the man standing at the intersection of Pines Road and West 70th Street. He was taken to University Health for treatment of his injury.
Surveillance footage from the restaurant showed a man who fit the description of the shooting victim entering the business, and officers determined the suspect on video was the same man suffering a gunshot wound.
Police believe the man — Martez D. Rasco-Miller, 17 — accidentally shot himself in the hand while attempting to burglarize the restaurant.
He was charged with aggravated burglary and booked into Shreveport City Jail.
